moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. c5 Nf6 4. Nf3 Nc6 5: ?  The black knight was just there.  Is black hoping white blunders?  Is black's position so perfect it cannot be improved?
moves.14. Nf3: Ok, that is just bizarre.  Dance of the knights.
moves.16. Na4 Nc8 17. Ne5 g6 18. Qf3 Bg7 19. N: Hm, I don't see it.  Knight for two pawns?  Oh, when black moves the rook white can snag the h5 pawn too.  Three pawns.  I guess it is a fair exchange then.  20 moves before the first capture.
moves.20... fxg6 21. Bxg6 Rf8 22. Bxh5 Nxh5 23: Mmpf.  d4 and b4 are now easy pickings.
moves.26... Qxd4+ 27. Kh1 Qxb4 28. Nxd5: :)  White makes back one of the pawns, except c5 goes bye.
moves.30. Nxa8 Be5 31. Rb1 Rf7: Shoot.  Pinning the queen against the rook with the bishop would have been nice.
moves.32. Be3: It isn't a credible threat if black can munch pawns.
moves.32... Qxa5 33. Qf2: Ouch!  Bxe4!  White sacrifices the entire western hemisphere's pawns, plus e4.
moves.33... Bxe4 34. Bd2 Qa2 35. Re1 Qd5 36. Q: Check with the knight doesn't work because of that black bishop.  Otherwise it would be game over.
moves.43. Qa2 Rh7 44. Bg5 Rxh2+ 45. Kg1 Qc5+ 4: White's queen is lost.  White was right to resign.
